title: Enrollment of IHC and Portfolio Companies in Ghaf Benefits Platform
description: IHC has signed an MoU with Lunate to explore enrolling itself and its over 1,200 subsidiaries in the Ghaf Benefits platform, an alternative end-of-service benefits fund solution. Ghaf Benefits, managed by Lunate and regulated by SCA and MoHRE, offers a mix of investment funds (including Shariah-compliant options) for employees’ end-of-service gratuities. This presents a real opportunity for companies under IHC and others in similar markets to upgrade employee benefits management, improve financial security for their staff, and enhance talent retention.
example: A healthcare company owned by IHC could use the Ghaf Benefits platform to manage end-of-service gratuities for its nurses and doctors, providing them investment-based financial growth instead of traditional lump sum payouts. Similarly, a real estate subsidiary could transition its employee gratuity scheme to Ghaf Benefits, offering both conventional and Shariah-compliant fund options, making the company more attractive for talent acquisition and retention in line with UAE employment trends.
roadmap: step 1: IHC and Lunate finalize the cooperation agreement for rolling out Ghaf Benefits across IHC’s subsidiaries.
step 2: Each subsidiary’s HR/finance teams are trained on the Ghaf Benefits’ onboarding and management tools.
step 3: Subsidiaries migrate existing end-of-service liabilities into Ghaf Benefits-managed funds.
step 4: Employees are educated on their new benefit options and can select preferred fund types (conventional or Shariah-compliant).
step 5: IHC and its subsidiaries monitor scheme performance and periodically review enhancement/expansion opportunities.
step 6: Strategic communication used to attract new talent and increase employee satisfaction via modern, flexible benefit schemes.
source_name: International Holding Company (IHC) signs MoU with Lunate to join Ghaf Benefits

title: Integration of Shariah-Compliant Employee Benefits Investment Funds
description: Ghaf Benefits offers Shariah-compliant fund options, addressing the growing demand for Islamic-compliant financial solutions in employee benefits. Companies operating in the UAE or the wider Middle East can cooperate with Lunate to upgrade or replace their traditional end-of-service gratuity systems with Shariah-compliant, regulated investment plans.
example: A financial services company or regional tech firm with a large Muslim workforce can replace standard end-of-service lump sum payments with a Shariah-compliant investment option through Ghaf Benefits. This enhances value for employees who seek faith-compliant financial services, improving employee satisfaction and bolstering the employer’s reputation.
roadmap: step 1: Engage with Lunate to evaluate current end-of-service benefit structures and compliance requirements.
step 2: Select and set up the relevant Shariah-compliant investment fund from Ghaf Benefits.
step 3: Educate the workforce and management on the benefits and workings of Shariah-compliant solutions.
step 4: Transition end-of-service accruals to Ghaf Benefits with employee consent.
step 5: Monitor investment performance and maintain ongoing Shariah compliance.
source_name: International Holding Company (IHC) signs MoU with Lunate to join Ghaf Benefits

title: Cross-Vertical Adoption of Ghaf Benefits by Large Holding Companies
description: Given IHC’s scale (over 1,200 subsidiaries across sectors), the successful implementation of Ghaf Benefits could serve as a blueprint for other major holding or investment companies in the region to upgrade their employee benefits programs, leveraging regulated, investment-backed alternatives for end-of-service gratuities.
example: Another large holding company in the Middle East (such as Mubadala or ADQ) could partner with Lunate to implement Ghaf Benefits across its portfolio, benefiting from streamlined administration, improved regulatory compliance, and increased attractiveness to international talent.
roadmap: step 1: Observe and assess IHC’s pilot integration with Ghaf Benefits for risk and operational learnings.
step 2: Open dialogue with Lunate and regulatory authorities for roadmap alignment.
step 3: Launch phased migration of end-of-service obligations across holding’s subsidiaries.
step 4: Track employee and company feedback, and iterate on scheme design.
step 5: Publicize adoption to stakeholders and use as a talent recruitment tool.
source_name: International Holding Company (IHC) signs MoU with Lunate to join Ghaf Benefits
